p: On the other hand, the shoot growth and root growth of B. pilosa seedlings were more affected than the germination, where the root growth was inhibited by 100.0% and 92.9%, for Egyptian and Saudi ecospecies, respectively ( Figure 3b). The seedling shoot growth showed a 100.0% and 90.9% reduction under the same treatment ( Figure 3a). It was clear that the root was affected by the EOs more than shoot, which could be ascribed to the direct contact with the EOs or due to the permeability of the membrane of root cells [ 14, 32, 39].
